section1.name: Definition of Interest
content: Interest is the amount of money that is paid on borrowed funds or the amount received on money that is lent.
The amount of money that is borrowed or lent is called the principal.
The total sum of the interest and the principal is referred to as the amount.
The percentage at which interest is charged on the principal is known as the rate of interest.
The duration for which the money is borrowed or deposited is referred to as the time.

section2.name: Types of Interest
content: Interest can be classified into two types: Simple Interest and Compound Interest.

section3.name: Simple Interest
content: Simple interest is calculated only on the principal amount for each year.
The formula for calculating simple interest is: Simple Interest = Principal × Rate of Interest × Time / 100.
In this formula: P represents the principal, r represents the rate of interest per year, and t represents the time period in years.
When the time period is given in months, convert it into years by dividing it by 12.
When the time period is given in days, convert it into years by dividing it by 365.

questions.question: What is the term for the amount of money borrowed or lent?
options: a) Interest
b) Principal
c) Amount
d) Rate of interest

questions.question: What is the formula for calculating Simple Interest?
options: a) Simple Interest = Principal × Rate × Time / 100
b) Simple Interest = Principal × Rate + Time
c) Simple Interest = Principal × Time / Rate
d) Simple Interest = Rate × Time / Principal
questions.answer: a) Simple Interest = Principal × Rate × Time / 100

questions.question: How is the total amount calculated in an interest transaction?
options: a) By adding the principal and interest
b) By subtracting the interest from the principal
c) By multiplying the principal and interest
d) By dividing the principal by the interest
questions.answer: a) By adding the principal and interest

questions.question: What is Compound Interest?
options: a) Interest calculated on the principal only
b) Interest calculated on the principal and accumulated interest
c) Interest calculated at a fixed rate
d) Interest that decreases over time
questions.answer: b) Interest calculated on the principal and accumulated interest

questions.question: What does 'time' refer to in the context of interest?
options: a) The duration for which the money is borrowed or deposited
b) The amount borrowed
c) The rate of interest per year
d) The total amount repaid
questions.answer: a) The duration for which the money is borrowed or deposited
